definition: knife/blade/single-edged sword/cutlass/CL:把[ba3]/(slang) dollar (loanword)/classifier for sets of one hundred sheets (of paper)/classifier for knife cuts or stabs

sentences.english: The family plate included a silver pitcher, and knives, forks and spoons.
sentences.chinese: 家庭餐具包括一个银制的大水罐，还有刀叉和汤匙。

sentences.english: I shall not be binning the knife and fork just yet.
sentences.chinese: 但是，我现在还不打算放弃刀叉。

sentences.english: I don't use knives and forks very often, look, how clumsy I am.
sentences.chinese: 我不经常使用刀叉，瞧我笨手笨脚的。

sentences.english: It's time for dinner. Mother keeps the knives with the forks.
sentences.chinese: 到吃饭时间了，妈妈将刀叉放在一起。

sentences.english: The earthquake sent the crockery and cutlery crashing to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 地震将杯盘刀叉震落在地上。

sentences.english: He took his knife and fork, and was going to commence eating, when the inclination appeared to become suddenly extinct.
sentences.chinese: 他拿起他的刀叉，正要开始吃，忽然又转念了。

sentences.english: Do not cut lettuce in a salad. Fold it using your knife and fork.
sentences.chinese: 不要用刀切断沙拉里的生菜，要用刀叉卷着吃。

sentences.english: But they got a lot of forks ' knives.
Don't clatter your knives and forks at table.
sentences.chinese: 吃饭时不要把刀叉弄得丁当乱响。

sentences.english: After eating a few mouthfuls, put downyour knife and fork and just take a break.
sentences.chinese: 当满口吃过几次食物后，记得放下刀叉休息一下。

sentences.english: The right way is to discharge the plate and knife and fork, the fork up teeth.
sentences.chinese: 正确方法是将刀叉并排放在碟上，叉齿朝上。

sentences.english: Westerners eat with forks and knives， while we Chinese eat with chopsticks.
sentences.chinese: 西方人用刀叉吃饭，而我们中国人用筷子吃饭。

sentences.english: Most Chinese food is prepared in bit-sized pieces and the absence of a knife on the table is not missed.
sentences.chinese: 大多数中国食物都是均块的，那副刀叉根本就没用。

sentences.english: Mrs Miller: Did you put two forks with each plate?
sentences.chinese: 你在每个盘子都配了两把刀叉了吗？

sentences.english: Don't clatter your knives and forks.
Some hold both firmly with the handles covered by the palm.
sentences.chinese: 有的人整个手掌都握着把儿，将刀叉抓得紧紧的。
